text: Members of the royal family have joined survivors of the Grenfell Tower fire and families of the bereaved at a memorial service held exactly six months after the tragedy on 14 June. Around 1, 500 people were invited to the multi - faith service at St Paul's Cathedral, including many of the emergency workers who helped to rescue people from the tower block in North Kensington. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Getty Images The Prince of Wales, Duchess of Cornwall, Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and Prince Harry were invited to remember the 71 people who lost their lives in the disaster, and to speak to some of the families affected. Prime Minister Theresa May and Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn were among the politicians in attendance.
